intro: Nasa loxensis, commonly known as the Loxense nasa, is a rare and unique plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its striking, velvety purple flowers that bloom in the early morning and close by midday. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs. Nasa loxensis is adapted to cold, humid environments and thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
